it depends on which kind of android phone you have, I have a Nexus 6P and it was $500, the iPhone 7 is $149 more but I like the Nexus a lot better because you can install third party apps without going to hell and back to jailbreak, and it has durable build quality + a really good camera that can take HDR pictures

one of the things I like about android is that it lets you install apks on your phone if you want to test an app you've made or use a third party app that isn't on the app store, I got my grandmother's old iPhone 4 and it won't let me install any apps that aren't on the app store, and jailbreaking without getting a virus or paying for it is a huge pain in the ass on any apple devices
